message.content:
cs.HC, cs.AI, cs.RO, cs.CYBER, cs.SI. 

The paper discusses the development of a computational inference engine for a system aimed at assisting elderly and people with special needs in performing Activities of Daily Living (ADL) at home. This involves the use of nearables and wearables to monitor and motivate the assisted person. Therefore, the paper is likely to belong to the Human-Computer Interaction (cs.HC) sub-category, as it deals with the design and evaluation of a technology aimed at improving the quality of life of a specific user group. Additionally, the paper involves the use of artificial intelligence (cs.AI) to develop the inference engine that can understand and motivate the assisted person. The use of nearables and wearables also suggests that the paper may belong to the Robotics (cs.RO) sub-category, as these technologies are often used in robotics research. The paper may also belong to the Cybersecurity (cs.CYBER) sub-category, as the use of nearables and wearables raises concerns about data privacy and security. Finally, the paper may belong to the Social and Information Networks (cs.SI) sub-category, as it deals with the development of a system that can improve social interactions and information sharing between the assisted person and their caregivers.
